attributes.action: order a cost/benefit assessment of adverts (including those on T.V.) targetting "benefit cheats"
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It must cost quite a lot to make and show these advertisements; especially the ones we see on T.V.  I live in London and I understand that this is the most expensive area for T.V. adverts; yet we see "benefit cheat" adverts on T.V. regularly.  I just wonder whether all this overkill is worth it: how many so-called "cheats" do these adverts expose and, above all, how much of taxpayers' money is retrieved as a result compared with the cost of the adverts?  If this assessment shows that the overkill is NOT worth it will you stop commissioning them?
